title: Stat zero
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

- *"Brainless" redirects here. If you were looking for the [monster intelligence](/Monster_intelligence "Monster intelligence") category, see [Category:Brainless intelligence](/Category:Brainless_intelligence "Category:Brainless intelligence").*

When one of a character's primary [attributes](/Attributes "Attributes") ([strength](/Strength "Strength"), [intelligence](/Intelligence "Intelligence"), or [dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity")) is lowered to 0 or below, the character suffers crippling penalties until that attribute is restored and stays above 0 for a period of time equal to: `10 + 1d10 + the number of turns it was below 0` (Max: 200 turns).

## Contents

- [1 Effects](#Effects)

  - [1.1 Collapse (Strength)](#Collapse_.28Strength.29)
  - [1.2 Brainless (Intelligence)](#Brainless_.28Intelligence.29)
  - [1.3 Clumsy (Dexterity)](#Clumsy_.28Dexterity.29)

- [2 Causes](#Causes)

- [3 Precautions](#Precautions)

- [4 History](#History)

## Effects

The following effects occur when any stat reaches 0:

- You immediately suffer 2-4 turns of [paralysis](/Paralysis "Paralysis"), which ignores a [Formicid](/Formicid "Formicid")'s [stasis](/Stasis "Stasis").
- You are [slowed](/Slow "Slow") until the stat completely recovers.

The following effects are dependent on the specific stat which was drained to 0:

### Collapse (Strength)

- You do not regenerate [HP](/HP "HP") when monsters are in sight.

### Brainless (Intelligence)

- You can't memorise or cast [spells](/Spell "Spell").
- You fail to read [scrolls](/Scroll "Scroll").

### Clumsy (Dexterity)

- Your [EV](/EV "EV") score is set to `2 + size_bonus + Repulsion field bonus`.
- Your [SH](/SH "SH") score is set to 0.
- Your [stealth](/Stealth "Stealth") score is set to 0.
- You can't [stab](/Stab "Stab") monsters.

## Causes

The following sources of **stat drain** can all temporarily lower your attributes ([Str](/Str "Str"), [Int](/Int "Int"), [Dex](/Dex "Dex")):

**By 1 at a time:**

- The [Deterioration](/Bad_mutations#Deterioration "Bad mutations") mutation.

- The melee attacks of certain monsters:

  - 5 [![Quasit.png](/images/1/1e/Quasit.png)](/File:Quasit.png) **[Quasit](/Quasit "Quasit")** (dexterity only)
  - y [![Ghost moth.png](/images/0/0b/Ghost_moth.png)](/File:Ghost_moth.png) **[Ghost moth](/Ghost_moth "Ghost moth")**
  - W [![Eidolon.png](/images/1/1d/Eidolon.png)](/File:Eidolon.png) **[Eidolon](/Eidolon "Eidolon")**

- Decomposition from attempted [mutation](/Mutation "Mutation") of an undead character.

**By more than 1 at a time:**

- [Corrupting Pulse](/Corrupting_Pulse "Corrupting Pulse") can give transient (temporary) mutations, which can include [Reduced Attributes](/Bad_mutations#Reduced_Attributes "Bad mutations") (-2 stat).
  - \* [![Wretched star.png](/images/e/eb/Wretched_star.png)](/File:Wretched_star.png) **[Wretched star](/Wretched_star "Wretched star")**
- [Brain Feed](/Brain_Feed "Brain Feed"): Drains 1-3 intelligence in one go.
  - 8 [![Orange crystal statue.png](/images/1/12/Orange_crystal_statue.png)](/File:Orange_crystal_statue.png) **[Orange crystal statue](/Orange_crystal_statue "Orange crystal statue")**
- [Hell's mystical force](/Hell%27s_mystical_force "Hell's mystical force") can drain up to 5 stat points when you descend down a stair, and can also give transient mutations.
- Mummy [death curses](/Death_curse "Death curse") drain from 1-4 of a random stat.
- Quaffing a [potion of degeneration](/Potion_of_degeneration "Potion of degeneration") drains 1-3 of each stat.
- [Throw Klown Pie](/Throw_Klown_Pie "Throw Klown Pie") can drain 1-3 of each stat.
  - p [![Killer Klown.png](/images/1/12/Killer_Klown.png)](/File:Killer_Klown.png) **[Killer Klown](/Killer_Klown "Killer Klown")**
- Stepping on or being in view of a monster stepping on [Zot traps](/Zot_trap "Zot trap"), which could drain 1-5 stat points.

As you gain experience, you regain stats lost through temporary drain or mutation.

Stats can be more permanently lowered by the following means:

- [Mutations](/Mutations "Mutations") (such as from [Malmutate](/Malmutate "Malmutate")) which affect attributes. This lasts until the mutation is removed [somehow](/Potion_of_mutation "Potion of mutation").
- Equipment with negative stat modifiers. But, you can remove the equipment to restore the stat.

## Precautions

Any character with a particularly low attribute should be aware of the dangers involved. Any attribute below 6 could conceivably be reduced to 0 by a single unfortunate effect, and below 11 are vulnerable to stat zero from repeated effects.

Specifically, [Hell](/Hell "Hell") effects can reduce an attribute by up to 5 in a single go, while [Zot traps](/Zot_trap "Zot trap"), and [mummy](/Mummy "Mummy") [death curses](/Death_curse "Death curse") reduce up to 4. You may wish to bring all of your attributes up to a minimum of 9 to guarantee that you can survive two worst-case scenario effects from the latter. All three happen reasonably late in the game, so early level ups should not take stat zero into account (unless you find a great stat-reducing artefact).

Outside of the extended game, stat zero only realistically happens to the extreme end of combinations, such as a [Minotaur](/Minotaur "Minotaur") [Berserker](/Berserker "Berserker") or [Deep Elf](/Deep_Elf "Deep Elf") [Conjurer](/Conjurer "Conjurer"). A [human](/Human "Human"), for example, is normally much less vulnerable to its effects.

## History

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), zero intelligence only had an 80% chance to fail reading scrolls. Zero strength's -Regen was a flat regen/4 modifier.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), [sustain attributes](/Sustain_attributes "Sustain attributes") existed which would halve stat damage. Hence, multi-point stat damage was roughly halved in [0.19](/0.19 "0.19").
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), taking further stat damage after a stat reached 0 would inflict HP damage.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), items had [mass](/Aum "Aum"), and strength determined your carrying capacity. Collapse seriously reduced this.
- Stat zero was added in [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), replacing [stat death](/Stat_death "Stat death").

    • * Wretched star
